comments_since_last_sample.body:
I'd be more concerned about China and Russia's involvement if the Mid-East wasn't so historically volatile. I do not foresee, given the history of the region, either of those two powers being able to export their particular brand of authoritarianism.

Do I regret the US not getting the 'win' to leverage later, sure, so long as I'm stuck here. But that's pretty petty compared to the opportunities opened by a more stable region.
